page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content:
GENERAL VIEW OF SURVEY BLOCK
Our survey block covers an area of very hilly grasslands,less hilly farmlands and a flatter area used by the R.A.F. Two of our kilometre squares contain the outer perimeter of land owned by the London Zoological Society known as Whipsnade Park Zoo. The highest area in the block includes Ivinghoe Beacon, part of the chain of hills known as the Chilterns.The Beacon is the site of an Ordnance Survey triangulation point and is much visited by sightseers due to the commanding views given of the surrouding countryside.One corner of our block contains part of the village of Dagnall, and we have included general information about life in the village in the survey.
